author: Kris Maher
title: Maryland to Other States: Stop Sending Us Your Dirty Air
text:
FROSTBURG, Md.—From a grassy hilltop in western Maryland, a high-tech spying operation tracks the source of pollution and ozone coming into the state.
The state’s regulators use such automated air-monitoring stations to distinguish if pollutants are coming from cars or power plants. Combining the measurements with federal data, Maryland has analyzed the emissions of every coal-fired power plant east of the Mississippi River and identified 36 in five states as top contributors to Maryland’s smog-producing ozone.
